parameter.name: Description:
parameter.defaultValue: A static layout algorithm that produces drawings of graphs where the root’s children are evenly spaced on a circle centered at the focus node and the children of nonroot nodes are evenly spaced on a semicircle emanating from their parent. From an algorithmic perspective, each node’s position depends only on its parent and siblings, not on its entire generation in contrast to the radial tree approach.

parameter.name: Reference:
parameter.defaultValue: Andrew Pavlo and Christopher Homan and Jonathan Schull, A parent-centered radial layout algorithm for interactive graph visualization and animation, Technical Report, http://arxiv.org/abs/cs/0606007, arXiv.org, June 2006.
